verses.roman:
sāyantanāśanaṁ kṛtvā
bhagavān devakī-sutaḥ
suhṛtsu vṛttaṁ kaṁsasya
papracchānyac cikīrṣitam

synonyms: sāyantana—of the evening; aśanam—the dining; kṛtvā—having done; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; devakī-sutaḥ—the son of Devakī; suhṛtsu—toward His well-wishing relatives and friends; vṛttam—about the behavior; kaṁsasya—of Kaṁsa; papraccha—He inquired; anyat—other; cikīrṣitam—intentions.
translation: After the evening meal, Lord Kṛṣṇa, the son of Devakī, asked Akrūra how Kaṁsa was treating their dear relatives and friends and what the King was planning to do.
